intro: Noronhia congesta, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant features velvety, dark green leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. Noronhia congesta thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect light for optimal growth. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
